snippet: Those who are born during whooping cough epidemics and survive them are more likely to die prematurely later in life, a new study suggests.
abstract: Lund University study led by Luciana Quaranta shows that people who are born during whooping cough epidemics and survive them are more likely to die prematurely later in life; lung infections in infancy may do subtle, permanent damage that make adult infections more life-threatening.
lead_paragraph: Those who are born during whooping cough epidemics and survive them are more likely to die prematurely later in life, a new study suggests.

headline.main: Whooping Cough Linked to Shorter Life Expectancy
headline.print_headline: Whooping Cough Linked to Shorter Life Expectancy
